Friendly Prompts The vehicle must be turned on to access this setting. Setting Unavailable Incorrect Code The selected language does not support Voice Recognition and Audio Feedback. Choose a different language to enable Voice Recognition and Audio Feedback. The selected language does not support Voice Recognition. Choose a different language to enable Voice Recognition. Voice Recognition Unavailable Voice Recognition / Feedback Unavailable Your new calibration has been saved. Touchscreen Calibration Successful Touchscreen Calibration Failed Your touchscreen calibration has not been saved. You must press the dot on the screen to complete the touchscreen calibration. You are about to erase app data settings, user profiles, and personal data in the vehicle including Navigation and Phone data. You are about to reset all of your radio system and application preference settings for the current user. Lock Codes Do Not Match The lock codes that you entered do not match. Press Retry and re-enter lock code to place your system into Valet Mode. Four Digit Lock Code Required The lock code must be 4 digits. Press Retry and enter the digits you set when placing the system into Valet Mode. Valet Mode – Enter Code to Unlock Teen Driver – Set 4 Digit PIN The code you have entered is incorrect. Enter the digits you set when placing the system into Valet Mode. Teen Driver – Confirm PIN Teen Driver Information Teen Driver Mode allows you to assign keys with customizable restrictions. Refer to your Owner\'s Manual for details. Four Digit PIN Required The PIN must be 4 digits. Teen Driver PIN successfully set. PIN Does Not Match The PIN that you entered does not match. You may retry entering the PIN to set Teen Driver Mode. You are about to remove the current Teen Driver Key. Remove Teen Driver Key Key Removed Add Teen Driver Key You are about to add the current key as a Teen Driver Key. The current key has been successfully removed as a Teen Driver key. When used, no Teen Driver restrictions will be applied. The current key has been successfully added as a Teen Driver key. When used, Teen Driver restrictions will be applied. Key Added Keyless Setup Setup Keys Key Not Detected Place the remote transmitter you want to add or remove in the registration pocket. First, place your key in the transmitter pocket and then press OK. See the Owner\'s manunal for pocket location. No key was detected. First, place the key in the transmitter pocket and then select Retry. Teen Driver – Clear All Keys and PIN Teen Driver active. Audio is muted until all seat belts are fastened. Fasten Seat belts Clear Report Card You are about to clear all the Report Card values. Select Clear All Teen Keys and PIN from the menu to retry. Clear All Teen Keys and PIN Success All keys and PIN were successfully cleared. Clear All Teen Keys and PIN Failed You have selected to clear all your Teen Driver keys and PIN. Settings
Feature unavailable while driving.
Ionizer Check the following items and try again: \n– Previously connected phone is in the vehicle \n– Phone has Bluetooth enabled \n– Phone has text message memory available Surround View Lighting Remote Removed From Vehicle Alert
%1$s Vehicle Hotspot Backup Settings To USB Restore Settings From USB Confirm Clear Your changes have not been specified. Press the Apply Changes button to confirm changes. Apply Changes First, place your key in the registration pocket and then press OK. See Owner’s Manual for pocket location. Keyless Setup Collections Device Remote Access Touchpad Energy Power Take-Off Seating Position Powertrain Brake Pedal Feel Traction and Stability Control Motorized Seatbelts Active Aero Personal Driving Mode Power Take-Off SiriusXM Explicit Content Filter Voice Recognition Sharing Types Used by Applications Apps Allowing %1$s Ambient Lighting Surround View Lighting Brake Pedal Feel Active Aero Weather Snow/Ice Powertrain TCS & ESC On
Key Not Detected No remote key was detected. First, place the key in the registration pocket and then select Retry. Mode Change Applied Mode Change Not Applied Demo Mode Unavailable Demo Mode The Demo Mode feature is unavailable while driving. Mode Unavailable Extended mode is unavailable when the vehicle is in gear. Place the vehicle in Neutral or Park. System unable to change to the selected setting values. Loss of Communication Feature unavailable due to loss of communication between modules. Settings Restored The user settings have been successfully restored. Restore Failed Please insert USB device containing the settings restore file %1$s to begin process. Insufficient Battery The settings cannot be restored when the battery is low. Charge the battery by running the vehicle or connect to a charger. You may then retry restoring the settings. Settings Backup Insert USB device to save user settings. Multiple USB devices present. Please remove all but one USB device in order to save user settings. Settings Backup Error There was an error writing to the USB device. Please insert USB device with sufficient free space and check that it is not write protected. There was an error saving the user settings. Please retry. If errors continue, please visit your dealer. Settings Backup Success The user settings have been saved successfully. Ionizer Touchpad Up / Down Invert Left / Right Invert Tap to Enter Cursor Tracking Speed Gesture Indication Haptic Feedback Touchpad Surface Go Notifier Auto Collision Preparation Automatic Running Boards Automatic Entry/Egress Assist Handsfree Liftgate/Trunk Control Remote Mirror Folding Remote Removed From Vehicle Alert Location Based Charging Energy Summary Pop-up Charge Status Feedback Charge Cord Theft Alert Charge Power Loss Alert Hybrid ECO Indicator Seating Position Ride Height Energy Location Based Auto Lift Seat Entry Memory Seat Exit Memory Teen Driver Entry Screen Cursor Tracking Speed Faster Normal Slower Enabled Information Gesture Indication Touchpad Surface Up / Down Invert Default Inverted Left / Right Invert Tap to Enter Location Based Charging Set Location Energy Summary Pop-up Charge Status Feedback Charge Cord Theft Alert Charge Power Loss Alert Hybrid ECO Indicator This setting indicates when you are driving in a manner that conserves fuel. Location Based Auto Lift Remote Mirror Folding Seat Entry Memory Offroad Tow/Haul Lowered Raised Automatic Running Boards Handsfree Liftgate/Trunk Control Extended
Stealth Eco Touring Tour Snow / Ice / Weather Normal TCS & ESC On Lowered Standby Speed Set 1 Speed Set 2 Speed Tap Step Speed Shutdown Time 900 RPM 1100 RPM 2000 RPM 5 RPM 10 Minutes 5 RPM 10 RPM 25 RPM 50 RPM 100 RPM 250 RPM 500 RPM Standby Speed Tap Step Speed Shutdown Time Set 1 Speed Set 2 Speed 900 RPM 1000 RPM 1100 RPM 1200 RPM 1300 RPM 1400 RPM 1500 RPM 1600 RPM 1700 RPM 1800 RPM 1900 RPM 2000 RPM 2100 RPM 2200 RPM 2300 RPM 2400 RPM 2500 RPM 2600 RPM 2700 RPM 2800 RPM 2900 RPM 3000 RPM 3100 RPM 10 Minutes 30 Minutes 1.5 Hours 2.5 Hours 3.5 Hours 4.5 Hours 5.5 Hours 6.5 Hours 7.5 Hours 2 Hours 3 Hours 4 Hours 5 Hours 6 Hours 7 Hours Ambient Lighting Information This application allows you to select a color for the ambient lighting in your vehicle. Select from the grid to change the lighting to your desired color.\n\n This feature can be turned off by using the on/off toggle button.\n\n The Link to Drive Mode option will change the Ambient Lighting to match the color being used in the instrument cluster based on the setting of the Drive Mode button.\n\n Demo mode will cycle the ambient lighting through all the available colors. This is only available when the vehicle is parked.
Voice On - At Ignition
Forward Automatic Braking: Reverse Automatic Braking: Distance Above Speed: Distance Unbuckled: : Restore Settings From USB Do not remove USB drive until restore has been completed. You may power down the vehicle and resume later at any time. Backup in progress…
Rear Seat Audio Controls MyMode Video Set Date allows you to manually set the date. Use the controls to adjust the date. Set Teen Driver Speed Warning specifies a speed limit for displaying a speed warning for Teen Drivers. The speed can be specified between %1$s and %2$s. Maximum Startup Volume limits the volume of audio sources when you start your vehicle. Startup Audio Volume Startup / Shutdown Audio Volume Startup Audio Volume controls the volume of infotainment system start-up sounds. Startup / Shutdown Audio Volume controls the volume of infotainment system start-up and shut-down sounds. Chime Volume sets the volume level for in-vehicle chimes such as door ajar or headlamps left on. Set Audio Volume Limit specifies the maximum allowable audio volume for Teen Drivers. Allow Prompt Interruptions Engine Sound AWD Optimization Video Voice Over
AWD Optimization specifices All wheel drive calibrations for specific driving conditions or style to improve vehicle performance. \nSelect Auto to link AWD to the Drive Mode selector. Adjusts engine sound character. Select Time Zone allows you to manually select the time zone. Use the controls to adjust the time. Display adjusts the appearance of the instrument cluster. Each specific drive condition or driving style has a complimentary cluster appearance. \nSelect Auto to link the Display to the Drive Mode selector. Reverse Tilt Mirror tilts one or both of the side-view mirrors down when the vehicle is shifted into Reverse. This improves the visibility of the ground near the rear wheels and is useful when parking next to a curb. Reverse Tilt Mirror tilts the side-view mirrors down when the vehicle is shifted into Reverse. This improves the visibility of the ground near the rear wheels and is useful when parking next to a curb. Auto Memory Recall adjusts the driver seat, steering column, pedal, and outside mirror positions. \nSelect On - Driver Door Open to recall the positions when the driver door opens. \nSelect On - At Ignition to recall the positions when the ignition is turned on. \nAuto Memory positions are dependent on which Remote Keyless Entry transmitter is used to unlock and start the vehicle. Left or Right Hand Traffic specifies the behavior of the Advanced Forward Lighting feature based on which side of the road the vehicle normally drives on.\nSelect Automatic (Navigation Based) to automatically adjust this setting based on detected vehicle location. Auto High Beam automatically turns the high beams On or Off based on surrounding traffic.\nLow Sensitivity reduces the amount of the time that high beams are automatically adjusted. Adaptive High Beam automatically adjusts high beams to direct light away from oncoming vehicles.\nLow Sensitivity reduces the amount of the time that high beams are automatically adjusted. Advanced Forward Lighting automatically adjusts the headlights based on driving conditions. Advanced Forward Lighting automatically adjusts headlights at corners and curves to provide greater road illumination. Auto memory Recall adjusts the driver seat, steering column, pedal, and outside mirror positions when you press the seat memory buttons or turn on the ignition. Left or Right Hand Traffic specifies the behavior of the Advanced Forward Lighting feature based on which side of the road the vehicle drives on. Auto High Beam specifies if the vehicle\'s high beams automatically turn On or Off based on surrounding traffic. Adaptive High Beam automatically adjusts high beams to direct light away from oncoming vehicles. Tap Step Speed defines the increments for adjusting the motor speed. \nUse the Set + and Res - steering wheel buttons to adjust the speed up or down by the selected increments. \nPower Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch. Auto Air Distribution controls the way air flows in the vehicle when using Auto Climate Control. Direct Airflow results in more air being directed toward the occupants. Diffuse Airflow results in less. Oscillating varies between direct and diffuse airflow Standby Speed specifies the initial speed to engage the Power Take-Off feature. This speed isn\'t needed to continue using the feature once it has been engaged. Power Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch. Set 1 Speed specifies the lower set of speeds the motor can run at while using Power Take-Off. \nPower Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch. Set 2 Speed specifies the upper set of speeds the motor can run at while using Power Take-Off. \nPower Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch. Shut Down Time sets the amount of time the vehicle engine will continue to run while using Power Take-Off. \nPower Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch, using its engine. Automatic Entry/Egress Assist specifies if the vehicle will automatically lower to make it easier to enter or exit the vehicle. Automatic Running Boards adjusts the position of the running boards on the vehicle. \nSelect On to automatically retract the running boards when the vehicle doors close or the vehicle is moving. \nSelect Extended to keep the running board out; the vehicle must be in Park or Neutral to select and use this mode. Automatic Running Boards adjusts the position of the running boards on the vehicle. \nSelect On to automatically retract the running boards when the vehicle doors close or the vehicle is moving. Hands-free Liftgate/Trunk Control specifies the behavior of the automated Liftgate/Trunk. \nSelect On - Open and Close to enable hands-free open and closing capability. \nSelect On-Open Only to prevent the liftgate from being closed using the hands-free operation. Language indicates the language displayed in the instrument cluster and radio displays. %1$s Passive Door Lock specifies if the vehicle will automatically lock, or lock and alert you after all the doors are closed, and you walk away from the vehicle with the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter. Auto Fan Speed controls the amount of airflow in the cabin (Low, Medium, or High) when climate control is set to Auto. Higher fan speeds result in faster temperature adjustments but may result in more in-cabin noise. Air Quality Sensor turns on Recirculation Mode based on detected outside air quality conditions. \nRecirculation Mode conditions and circulates cabin air rather than using outside air. Alert Type refers to the type of alert you will receive from driver assistance systems to help you avoid crashes, either Beeps or Safety Alert Seat vibration pulses. Front Pedestrian Detection alerts you when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly ahead and, if necessary, automatically applies the brakes to help reduce the collision\'s severity or avoid the collision. Auto door Unlock specifies which, if any, doors will automatically unlock when the vehicle is shifted into park. Gesture Indication lets you use various hand gestures to over the touchpad to interact with the display screen. Touchpad Surface turns the touchpad controller On or Off. Vehicle Locator Lights briefly turns on the exterior lights when you press the unlock button on the Remote Keyless Transmitter. Daytime Tail Lights turns on the tail lights during daytime driving to improve the visibility of the vehicle to other drivers. Open Door Anti Lock Out prevents the vehicle from being locked while a door is open. Auto Door Lock automatically locks doors when the vehicle is shifted out of Park, or when the vehicle starts moving. Auto Door Lock automatically locks doors when the vehicle starts moving. Delayed Door Lock will lock the vehicle a short time after all doors are closed. Remote Unlock Light Feedback provides confirmation that the vehicle is unlocked. Select Flash Lights to flash the exterior lamps when you remotely unlock the vehicle. Remote Door Unlock adjusts which door is unlocked when pressing the unlock button once on the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter. Relock Remotely Unlocked Doors secures the vehicle if doors are not opened within 30 seconds of using the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter to unlock doors. Remote Start allows you to start the vehicle from a remote distance by pressing the Remote Start button on the Keyless Entry transmitter. Remote Window Operation allows you to open or close the windows remotely. Passive Door Unlock specifies which doors unlock when you use the button on the driver door handle to unlock the vehicle. Selecting Off will turn off passive door unlocking for all doors. Remote Left in Vehicle Alert alerts you when the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter is left in the vehicle and the vehicle is not running. Automatic Time and Date uses GPS, RDS, and cellular network signals to keep the system time and date current. Select Off to manually set time and date. Automatic Time Zone updates the system time zone based on vehicle location. Select Off to manually select the time zone.
Trailering Side Trailer Cameras Trailer Length Overlay Jack-Knife Alerts Cargo Bed Camera Lighting Side Trailer Cameras specifies if using the turn signal during a lane change will also display an applicable sideview of your trailer and vehicle. This allows you to see the area to the side of the vehicle and trailer that may otherwise be obscured.
Trailer Length Overlay specifies if guidelines corresponding to the length of the trailer are shown when the side trailer camera is active. Set Trailer Length thru the trailer application.
Jack-Knife Alerts specifies if alerts occur while you are backing up and your trailer is about to jack-knife.
Cargo Bed Camera Lighting specifies if the truck bed rail lights are turned on when the cargo bed camera is active.
24-hour Format changes the time display to a 24-hour clock format. For example, 7:00pm displays as 19:00 when On. Startup Sounds Startup / Shutdown Sounds Startup sounds specifies if sounds play when your infotainment system starts up. Startup / Shutdown sounds specifies if sounds play when your infotainment system starts up or shuts down. Audible Touch Feedback specifies if sounds play when you press the touchscreen or a physical control on the radio faceplate. Rear Seat Reminder displays an alert in the instrument cluster when an infant or large object may have been left in the vehicle. Sport Steering stiffens the steering feel while in Sport Mode. Pollution Control turns on Recirculation Mode at low vehicle speeds such as heavy traffic. This helps improve air quality by circulating interior air rather than using outside air. Auto Heated Seats automatically turn on seat heating at vehicle start up when the cabin temperature is significantly cooler than desired. Auto Cooled Seats automatically turn on seat cooling at vehicle start up when the cabin temperature is significantly warmer than desired. Auto Defog automatically directs air to the windshield to assist in defogging, based on temperature and humidity conditions. Rear Climate On startup controls the rear climate system behavior at vehicle startup.\nMimic Front syncs the rear settings with the front driver climate settings.\nLast Known retains the rear climate settings from the prior trip. Auto Air Distribution controls the way air flows in the vehicle when using Auto Climate Control. Direct Airflow results in more air being directed toward the occupants. Diffuse Airflow results in less. The Ionizer improves air quality by reducing smells and airborne dust particles within the vehicle. Engine Assisted Heating uses the gasoline engine to assist in heating the cabin of the vehicle. The engine starts to save battery power when On.\nUse Deferred to turn on the engine only in extremely cold conditions. Pedestrian Friendly Alert plays a sound outside of your vehicle when travelling at low speeds to help pedestrians hear you. Connected Vehicle Braking Alert notifies you if Vehicle-to-Vehicle (V2V) connected vehicles in front of you suddenly brake, giving you more time to react. Connected Vehicle Traffic and Roadside Information specifies if connected vehicles or devices ahead of you share traffic conditions or events that could affect your travel. Drowsy Driver Alert notifies you when your driving behavior suggests that you are too tired to drive. Adaptive Cruise Go Notifier alerts you when Adaptive Cruise Control brings the vehicle to a complete stop behind another stopping vehicle and that vehicle begins moving again. Side Blind Zone Alert provides side mirror alerts to help you avoid crashing into a moving vehicle detected in your side-blind spot (or zone) during a lane-change maneuver. Lane Change Alert provides side-mirror alerts to help you avoid crashing into a moving vehicle detected in their side blind spot (or zone) or a vehicle that is rapidly approaching your side blind spot during a lane-change maneuver. Seat Belt Tightening automatically adjusts your seat belts to a snug fit when buckled. The seat belts tighten when you first buckle up and during rough driving or road conditions. Park Assist can alert you to objects near your vehicle during low speed maneuvers to avoid or reduce the severity of a collision. Parking Assist Towbar specifies if Park Assist will work properly when a small item, such as a hitch ball, is attached to the vehicle hitch. Rear Camera Parking Assist Symbols are warning icons displayed on the camera view when the Parking Assist System detects an object. Rear Cross Traffic Alert can alert you to traffic approaching from the rear left or rear right of your vehicle during low speed backing maneuvers. Easy Exit Driver Seat adjusts the driver seat when you press the easy exit button or turn off and exit the vehicle. Easy Exit Options specifies if pressing the Easy Exit button will move the driver seat rearward when exiting the vehicle. Auto Mirror Folding allows the outside mirrors to be folded in by pressing the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter lock button for about 1 second. Pressing unlock on the remote unfolds the mirrors. Personalization by Driver updates your personal vehicle settings based on the key being used. Rain Sense Wipers automatically turn on the windshield wipers when moisture is detected and the wiper switch is in the intermittent mode. Rain sensitivity can be adjusted by rotating the intermittent wiper control. Auto Wipe in Reverse Gear automatically turns on the rear window wiper when the vehicle is in Reverse and moisture is detected. Exit Lighting specifies how long the exterior lamps stay on when you exit the vehicle and it is dark outside.
Surround View Lighting turns on vehicle side lights to improve image quality when using the Surround View camera system. Remote Removed From Vehicle Alert warns you by beeping the horn 3 times if you exit the a running vehicle with the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter. Tap to Enter allows you to tap the touchpad to make a selection. This lets you skip pushing a button or touching the screen. Haptic Feedback lets you feel vibrations in the touchpad when you interact with buttons or links on the display screen. Location Based Charging configures the charge settings for your electric vehicle based on its geographic location. Energy Summary Pop-up displays a summary of your battery and fuel usage since your last full charge before you exit the vehicle. Charge Status Feedback provides an audible and/or visual indication outside the vehicle while charging. Charge Cord Theft Alert warns you if your charge cord may have been stolen by flashing your vehicle\'s lights and honking its horn. Charge Power Loss Alert warns you that your vehicle is no longer charging by flashing your vehicle\'s lights and honking its horn. Location Based Auto Lift Changes the vehicle ride height based on GPS location. \nUse the Navigation system to specify locations where ride height should changed.
Antilock Brake System Active: Lane Keep Assist Alerts: This Vehicle is Recording Audio and Video Brake Response Competition Mode WARNING Link to\nDrive Mode Set Time allows you to manually set the time. Use the controls to adjust the time.
OFF AWD Optimization specifices All Wheel Drive calibrations for specific driving conditions or style to improve vehicle performance while in %1$s. Engine Sound actively adjusts the sound of the engine to best match intended driving conditions or style while in %1$s. On Engine Sound actively adjusts the sound of the engine to best match intended driving conditions or style while in %1$s. Reduced Standard Enhanced Performance Steering adjusts how the steering feels to best match intended driving conditions or style while in %1$s. Suspension adjusts damper and/or spring rates for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s. Brake Response adjusts the brake pedal response for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s. Ride Height specifies which vehicle ride height to use while in %1$s.
Rapid Heat - Elevated Idle Auto Mode Customization controls Drive Modes based on your driving style. It can automatically switch the vehicle into or between Sport, Comfort, and Tour settings. Adjusts steering effort to best match intended driving conditions or preference.
Automatic High Beam Assist specifies how the headlights adjust based on driving conditions.\nSelect IntelliBeam to automatically switch to High Beam if no oncoming traffic is detected.\nSelect Glare Free High Beam to leave high beams on at all times and automatically change the direction of the light to avoid glare based on the traffic and environment. This setting adjusts the appearance of the navigation map view and any downloaded apps optimized for day or night time conditions. Set to Auto for the display to automatically adjust based on bright/dark conditions. Cursor Tracking Speed controls how fast the cursor and highlight move around the screen. You can speed up or slow down the touchpad\'s response to your movements. Ride Height specifies which vehicle ride height to use in this mode.\nChanging the ride height can impact ground clearance, fuel economy, and entry/exit of vehicle. Powertrain optimizes the characteristics of the throttle pedal, throttle response, engine and gear shifting for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s. Competition Mode Competitive Driving Mode - Active Handling Off PTM Mode 1 - Wet Track: %1$s On PTM Mode 2 - Dry Track: %1$s On PTM Mode 3 - Dry Track +: %1$s Off PTM Mode 4 - Dry Track +: %1$s Off PTM Mode 5 - Race %1$s Off Competition Mode adjusts key vehicle characteristics such as, active handling, and electronic stability control to improve vehicle performance on race tracks. Performance Traction Management (PTM) is intended for track use only and integrates the Traction Control, StabiliTrak, and Magnetic Ride Control systems to provide improved and consistent performance when cornering. The amount of available engine power is based on the mode selected, track conditions, driver skill, and the radius of each corner. Active Handling Controls (Traction Control and Electronic Stability Control) are reduced or turned off in performance Traction Modes (PTM) (1-5). This setting only applies while in Custom Drive Mode. Easy Exit Steering Column specifies if, and how, the steering column moves when you press the easy exit button or exit the vehicle. Remote Start Auto Cooled Seats automatically turns on cooled seats when using the Remote Start function on warm days. Remote Start Auto Heated Seats automatically turns on heated seats when using the Remote Start function on cold days. Intersection Stop Alert can alert you when you are about to drive through a red light or when you enter an intersection and the vehicle detects a potential crash. Intersection Stop Alert can alert you when you are about to drive through a red light or when you enter an intersection and the vehicle detects a potential crash. It can prevent or reduce the severity of a crash by helping you brake. Rear Pedestrian Detection alerts you while in reverse gear when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly behind and, if necessary, automatically applies the brakes to help reduce the collision’s severity or avoid the collision. Rear Pedestrian Detection alerts you while in reverse gear when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly behind to help reduce the collision’s severity or avoid the collision. Proximity Sensing controls the display of buttons in the map view. When On, buttons appear only when you move your hand toward the touchscreen. Select Off to keep the buttons visible at all times. Sport Display adjusts the appearance of the instrument cluster to a sport themed display while in Sport Mode. Sport Suspension stiffens the suspension feel while in Sport Mode. Sport AWD optimizes All wheel drive calibrations to improve vehicle performance while in Sport Mode. Sport Driver Seat adjusts the driver seat bolsters for increased lateral support while in Sport Mode. Sport Passenger Seat adjusts the passenger seat bolsters for increased lateral support while in Sport Mode. Sport Adaptive Cruise Control enables enhanced dynamic behavior of adaptive cruise control mode while in Sport Mode. Rapid Heat - Elevated Idle increases the engine idle speed to heat the cabin of the vehicle faster. Rapid Heat -Elevated Idle Engine Assisted Heating Plugged In uses the gasoline engine to assist in heating the cabin of the vehicle while it is charging. The engine starts to save battery power when On. Extended Hill Start Assist Extended Hold Standard Hold Teen Driver Speed Warning warns you when a Teen Driver exceeds the specified maximum speed.\nSet the speed warning threshold under Set Teen Driver Speed Warning. Teen Driver Speed Limiter restricts the vehicle to a maximum speed of %1$d MPH/ %2$d km/h for Teen Drivers. Location Services allows apps and services to identify your vehicle location for improved performance. You can turn location services Off to keep this information private. Emergency services are not affected in Off mode. Data Services allow apps to use your data plan for downloads and streaming. You can turn data sharing Off to prevent data use. Emergency services are not affected in Off mode. Video Voice Over specifies if visually impaired users will receive audio feedback for video playback and when navigating the rear seat entertainment system. Allow Prompt Interruptions controls if you can speak voice commands before voice prompts finish. You can turn this On if you usually know the command you want to speak and don\'t need to hear the full prompt. This feature may result in accidental interruptions caused by background noise or talking. Rear Seat Audio Controls turns the 2nd-row audio controls On or Off. SiriusXM Explicit Content Filter prevents Teen drivers from accessing explicit content channels. Remote Mirror Folding allows the outside mirrors to be folded in by pressing the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter lock button for about 1 second. Pressing unlock on the remote unfolds the mirrors. Remote Mirror Folding adjusts the outside mirrors when locking and unlocking the vehicle. Press the lock button on the key or on the door handle to fold the mirrors in. Press the unlock button on the key or door handle to unfold the mirrors. Mirrors will not unfold using the unlock buttons if they were folded in using the interior mirror switch. This setting recalls positions for the driver seat and steering column, outside mirrors, and pedals (if equipped) of memory button 1 or 2 when the ignition is turned on. If the previously stored positions are not recalled, try using the other remote. This setting recalls positions for the driver seat and steering column, outside mirrors, and pedals (if equipped) of the exit memory button when the ignition is turned off and the driver door is opened. This application allows you to select a color for the ambient lighting in your vehicle.\nSelect from the grid to change the lighting to your desired color. \n\nThis feature can be turned off by using the on/off toggle button. \n\nThe Link to Drive Mode option will change the Ambient Lighting to match the color being used in the instrument cluster based on the setting of the Drive Mode button. \n\nDemo mode will cycle the ambient lighting through all the available colors. This is only available when the vehicle is parked. \n\nBrightness can be adjusted from low to medium to high by using the icons at the bottom of the screen. Direct Airflow Adjusts damper level for specific driving conditions or preference. Brake Response adjusts the brake pedal response for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s. Active Aero specifies which active aeroynamics setting is used while in %1$s. \nEach setting adjusts the rear wing/spoiler and other aerodynamic elements to optimize vehicle performance for specific conditions or driving style. Active Aero specifies which active aeroynamics setting is used while in %1$s. \nEach setting adjusts the rear wing/spoiler and other aerodynamic elements to optimize vehicle performance for specific conditions or driving style. Audio Volume Limit specifies if audio sound is limited for Teen Drivers. Adjust the maximum volume under the Set Audio Volume Limit setting. Left / Right Invert specifies on-screen behavior in response to the horizontal movement of your fingers on the Touchpad.\nSelect Default to have the screen behavior match finger movement on the Touchpad. \nSelect Inverted to have screen behavior behave opposite. Up / Down Invert specifies on-screen behavior in response to the vertical movement of your fingers on the Touchpad.\nSelect Default to have the screen behavior match finger movement on the Touchpad. \nSelect Inverted to have screen behavior behave opposite. Extended Hill Start Assist prevents your vehicle from rolling backward on a steep hill if the brake pedal is not depressed.\nStandard hold keeps the vehicle stationary for about 3 seconds. Extended hold works for up to 5 minutes, and may also automatically apply the parking brake. Remote Lock Feedback provides confirmation that the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter locked the vehicle. Select Lights and Horn to flash the exterior lamps and honk the horn when you lock the vehicle using the remote. Vehicle Locator Lights briefly turns on the exterior lights when you press the unlock button on the Remote Keyless Transmitter.
Voice Recognition Sharing sends your voice sessions to a cloud-based voice recognition system. You can turn this off to prevent the system from sharing and recording your voice. This may limit the system\'s ability to understand you and may disable some features. Suspension adjusts damper and/or spring rates for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s. – unverified Not Signed In Vehicle Software Profile Extended Hill Start Assist Extended Hold Standard Hold Erase Settings and Personal Data Relock Teen Mode - Enter Code to Unlock no content available Android Auto allows you to interact directly with your phone on the radio screen. This feature must be enabled both here and on the connected phone. You can access the feature by pressing the Android Auto icon on the home screen, or by a long press of the Voice button on the steering wheel. Apple CarPlay allow you to interact directly with your phone on the radio screen. This feature must be enabled here with you preferred connection method and a supported phone must be connected. You can access the feature by pressing the CarPLay icon on the home screen, or by a long press of the Voice button on the streeing wheel. MirrorLink allows you to interact directly with your phone on the radio screen. This feature must be enabled here and a supported device must be connected. You can access the feature by pressing the MirrorLink icon on the home screen,or by a long press of the Voice button on the steering wheel. NFC Help "" Parking Assist Towbar specifies if Park Assist will work properly when a small item, such as a hitch ball, is attached to the vehicle hitch. Front Pedestrian Braking alerts you when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly ahead and, if necessary, automatically applies the brakes or steers to help reduce the collision\’s severity or avoid the collision.
Rear Pedestrian Detection alerts you while in reverse gear when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly behind %1$s to help reduce the collision’s severity or avoid the collision.
Automatic Entry/Egress Automatic Entry/Egress Assist specifies if the vehicle will automatically lower to make it easier to enter or exit the vehicle.
Forward Collision System can alert you to a potential crash with a detected vehicle ahead and, if you haven’t already, it can apply brakes to help reduce a collision’s severity. Forward Collision System can alert you to a potential crash with a detected vehicle ahead and, if you haven\'t already, it can apply brakes and steer to help reduce a collision\'s severity.

Location Services allows apps and services to use your vehicle location, which can improve performance. Selecting Off prevents in-vehicle apps from accessing your vehicle location. Other services, including emergency services and navigation, are not affected. Location Services allows apps and services to use your vehicle location, which can improve performance. Selecting Off prevents apps and services, other than navigation and emergency services, from accessing your vehicle location.
Power Liftgate Power Liftgate lets you decide what happens when you press the Power Liftgate switch.\n\nSelect Open Fully to enable power open and close capability to the full door height.\n\nSelect Open to Custom Height to enable power open and close, but open only to a specified height to prevent damage. To set the Custom Height open the liftgate to the desired height, then press and hold the open button on the outside of the liftgate until the turn signals flash and a beep sounds. See owner\'s manual for detailed instructions.\n\nSelect Off to disable the Power Liftgate switch and only allow manual operation of the liftgate. Open Fully Open to Custom Height
Buckle to Drive Buckle to Drive prevents you from shifting out of Park if your driver or passenger seat belts are not buckled. Setting Restricted Buckle to Drive is turned On in Teen Driver settings. It cannot be turned off while Teen Driver is active.

Switch to V-Mode or My Mode to edit Drive Mode settings. Switch to My Mode to edit Drive Mode settings. Drive Mode settings are now editable. Suspension and Engine / Shift settings will be affected. Steering Suspension Engine/Shift Brake Feel Brake Feel,Brake Response Engine Sound Active Aero PTM Edit Suspension and Engine / Shift settings will be affected.\nTCS / ESC will be limited or disabled. Subsystem Name %1$s Mode Engine Sound adjusts the volume of engine noise. Engine sound gets louder as you move from Stealth through Track. The steering wheel offers better feedback but requires more effort as you move from Tour through Track. Suspension adjusts the stiffness of the shocks and / or springs. The ride is more comfortable at lower settings and is stiffer at higher settings for better control. AWD allows adjustment of All Wheel Drive calibrations for optimized intended driving conditions. Tour gives best fuel economy, while Track gives best handling. Engine/Shift adjusts the throttle response and gear shifting. An increased throttle response enhances the acceleration feel as you move towards track, but with a comfort trade-off due to more aggressive gear shifting Brake Feel adjusts the brake pedal response. Brake pedal travel decreases and caliper pressure increases as you move from Comfort through Track. PTM controls vehicle performance systems for professional handling on race tracks. Traction Control and Stability Control are reduced as you move through Race. Changing PTM settings may also automatically change other settings. %1$s Mode Configuration

Africa English Danish Romanian Norwegian Finnish Croatioon Slovenion Czeh Slovak Bulgarian Ukarinian Serbian Japanese This setting is a part of the Power Take-Off feature. With this setting enabled you can press up or down on the steering wheel buttons to change the speed of the engine by set increments (similar to adjusting cruise control). The Power Take-Off feature makes it possible to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch, using your vehicleâs engine. SettingsAutomaticTimeZoneActivity

Set Number of Audio Favorites specifies how many pages of audio favorites are available. Select Auto to let the system adjust this number based on the number of favorites you\'ve saved.
Connected Vehicle Braking Alert notifies you if Vehicle-toVehicle (V2V) connected vehicles in front of you suddenly brake, giving you more time to react. Connected Vehicle Traffic and Roadside Information specifies if connected vehicles or devices ahead of you share traffic conditions or events that could affect your travel. Lane Change Alert provides side-mirror alerts to help you avoid crashing into a moving vehicle detected in their side blind spot (or zone) or a vehicle that is rapidly approaching your side blind spot during a lane-change maneuver. Park Assist can alert you to objects near your vehicle during low speed maneuvers. Parking Assist Towbar specifies if Park Assist will work properly when a small item, such as a hitch ball, is attached to the vehicle hitch Side BeltZone Alert Seatbelt Tightening

@string/cadillac_display_weather
Pedestrian Friendly Alert Sound determines which sound plays when Pedestrian Friendly Alert is On Forward Collision System can alert you to a potential crash with a detected vehicle ahead and, if you haven’t already, it can apply brakes %and steer% to help reduce a collision’s severity Front Pedestrian Detection alerts you when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly ahead and, if necessary, automatically applies the brakes to help reduce the collision’s severity or avoid the collision Intersection Stop Alert can alert you when you are about to drive through a red light or when you enter an intersection and the vehicle detects a potential crash. %It can prevent or reduce the severity of a crash byhelping you brake.% Connected Vehicle Braking Alert notifies you if Vehicle-to-Vehicle (V2V) connected vehicles in front of you suddenly brake, giving you more time to react. Side Blind Zone Alert provides side mirror alerts to help you avoid crashing into a moving vehicle detected in your side-blind spot (or zone) during a lane-change maneuver. Lane Change Alert provides side-mirror alerts to help you avoid crashing into a moving vehicle detected in their side blind spot (or zone) or a vehicle that is rapidly approaching your side blind spot during a lane-change maneuver. Rear Pedestrian Detection alerts you while in reverse gear when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly behind %and, if necessary, automatically applies the brakes% to help reduce the collision’s severity or avoid the collision
